Having trouble with the platform? Have a suggestion for the Burito team? Fill out the form below or reach us directly.
Message sent successfully! We will get back to you soon.
You may have noticed that Burito does not annoy you with a "Accept Cookies" pop-up. This is intentional. We believe in a clean, distraction-free educational environment.
We do not track you. We do not use third-party analytics (like Google Analytics), advertising pixels, or marketing trackers. Therefore, we do not require your consent.
To make the application work, we only store strictly necessary technical data on your device (Local Storage or Session Cookies). This data is essential for:
Authentication: Keeping you logged in securely while you navigate.
Security: Preventing Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) attacks.
Preferences: Temporarily saving your language choice (e.g., FR/EN).
Instead of traditional cookies, Burito primarily uses Local Storage. This is a modern technology that allows us to save your session token directly in your browser.
Never leaves your browser to go to third-party servers.
Is automatically cleared when you log out.
Is strictly invisible to other websites.

Since we do not use persistent tracking cookies, there is nothing to "opt-out" of. However, you can always clear your browser's Local Storage or cache through your browser settings if you wish to remove all traces of your session immediately.
If you have technical questions about how we handle session storage, please refer to our Privacy Policy or contact the administrator.

The website Burito is developed as part of the "Advanced Programming" course (ST2APR) for the 2025-2026 academic year.
Project Type: Educational software engineering project.
Goal: Teacher evaluation and educational quality assessment.
This website is published and managed by the student development team:
Team Representative: Paul MairesseContact: paul.mairesse@efrei.netAddress: 30-32 Avenue de la République, 94800 Villejuif, France.
During the development and evaluation phase, the application is hosted on:

All source code, designs, and architecture produced for Project Burito are subject to the intellectual property regulations of the university. The content is protected by copyright law. Unauthorized reproduction, modification, or commercial use is strictly prohibited without prior consent.
This system is an academic prototype. The publishers cannot be held responsible for:
Inaccuracies in the test data used for demonstration purposes.
Direct or indirect damages resulting from the use of this platform.
The collection and processing of personal data on this site are governed by our Privacy Policy, in compliance with the GDPR.
These legal mentions are governed by French law. In the event of a dispute, and in the absence of an amicable agreement, the courts of jurisdiction will be those of Paris, France.
View, edit, or onboard new students.

View, edit, or onboard new teaching staff.
Are you sure you want to delete this teacher?

Welcome to Burito. We are committed to protecting your personal data and respecting your privacy. This policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your information within the framework of evaluating educational quality at the institution.
In accordance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), we ensure transparency and security in the processing of educational data.
Identifiers: Name, role (Student, Teacher, Administrator), and institutional IDs.
Quantitative Evaluations: Survey responses and ratings.
Qualitative Feedback: Open comments and suggestions.
Honesty is paramount to us. That is why we guarantee that:
Student anonymity is strict. Teachers and administrators cannot, under any circumstances, link a specific response to a student's identity.
The collected data is used to:
Provide teachers with summaries for self-improvement.
We implement high-level security and encryption measures to protect sensitive information against unauthorized access.
As a user (Student, Teacher, or Administrator), you have the right to access, rectify, and object to the processing of your personal data.
For any questions regarding this policy, please contact the educational administration.

By accessing and using the Burito platform, you agree to comply with and be bound by these Terms of Service. If you do not agree to these terms, please do not use the system.
Burito is designed to facilitate constructive and accessible evaluations of teaching staff. The goal is to enhance the educational experience through honest feedback.
As a user (Student, Teacher, or Administrator), you agree to:
Keep your login credentials secure and confidential.
Respect the privacy and rights of others within the institution.
While we encourage honest feedback, we maintain strict standards regarding the content of evaluations:
Constructive Feedback Only. Hate speech, harassment, profanity, and personal attacks are strictly prohibited. Feedback should focus on professional performance and teaching methodology.
Administrators reserve the right to remove comments that violate these guidelines.
The design, code, and architecture of the Burito platform are the property of the development team and the University. Unauthorized reproduction or redistribution is prohibited.
The system is provided "as is". The administration is not liable for any technical interruptions or data loss, although we strive for high availability and security.
We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Continued use of the platform after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.
For any concerns regarding these terms or reported misuse, please contact the System Administrator.
